newsitem.title: LATVIA: Latvian share trade slips, most shares gain.
newsitem.headline: Latvian share trade slips, most shares gain.

text.p: Trade on the Latvian stock exchange was quieter on Friday although most shares showed gains, the bourse said.
Overall turnover was 133,740 lats compared with Thursday's 197,461 lats.

The highest turnover was in Daugavpils Chain on the secondary list on 27,772 lats as it rose to 2.12 lats from 2.09 lats. On the official list, Unibanka turned over just 2,912 lats and was unchanged at 3.20 lats.
Riga Transport Fleet traded 18,720 lats and was also stable at 1.60 lats while Staburadze saw volume of 17,160 lats.
It was a touch higher at 2.40 lats versus 2.34 lats.

Other active shares on the secondary list included fish canneries Kaija on trade of 26,630 lats as it gained four santimes to two lats and Salacgriva on turnover of 24,261 lats, gaining strongly to 5.23 lats from 4.55 lats.
The Roja fish cannery saw business of 4,987 lats but was stable at 2.85 lats while Rigas Raugs yeast plant traded 4,844 lats and climbed to four lats from 3.85 lats.
